definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
sentences.chinese: 要将盆放在会幕和坛的中间，在盆里盛水。

sentences.english: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
sentences.chinese: 米施利米雅的儿子撒迦利雅是看守会幕之门的。

sentences.english: But now the Tabernacle was to be set up.
sentences.chinese: 但如今，以色列民却要将会幕固定地设立在示罗。

sentences.english: So all the work on the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, was completed.
sentences.chinese: 帐幕，就是会幕，一切的工就这样做完了。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在供物的头上，宰于会幕门口。

sentences.english: place the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and put water in it.
sentences.chinese: 把洗涤盆安在会幕和坛的中间，在盆里盛水。

definition: Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
Book of Leviticus/Third Book of Moses
